words.def: a holder attached to the gunwale of a boat that holds the oar in place and acts as a fulcrum for rowing
a building where travelers can pay for lodging and meals and other services
(Middle Ages) a person who is bound to the land and owned by the feudal lord
unwillingness to do something contrary to your custom
A small piece of woodland or a woody hill; a copse.
an opening into or through something
helicopter.
enameled or lacquered metalware (usually gilded and elaborately painted)
With a comparative or more and a verb phrase, establishes a parallel with one or more other such comparatives.
a branch of the Tai languages

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
made warm or hot (`het' is a dialectal variant of `heated')
a tool with a flat blade attached at right angles to a long handle
used of physical heat
(often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
telegraph.
a brutal terrorist group active in Kashmir
one of the digits of the foot
County/City (Proper noun)
City in Burkina Faso (Proper noun)
Object Linking and Embedding .
Of bad quality.
a midwestern state in north central United States in the Great Lakes region
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
angular distance above the horizon (especially of a celestial object)
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
A small island.
